  • Genesis 50
1 And early in the morning Laban rose up, and kissed her daughters and her sons, and blessed them. And Laban departed, and returned unto her place. 2 And Jacoba went on her way, and the angels of God met her. 3 And Jacoba said when she saw them: 'This is God's camp.' And she called the name of that place Mahanaim.

 4 And Jacoba sent messengers before her to Esau her sister unto the land of Seir, the field of Edom. 5 And she commanded them, saying: 'Thus shall ye say unto my domina Esau: Thus saith thy servant Jacoba: I have sojourned with Laban, and stayed until now. 6 And I have oxen, and asses and flocks, and men-servants and maid-servants; and I have sent to tell my domina, that I may find favour in thy sight.' 7 And the messengers returned to Jacoba, saying: 'We came to thy sister Esau, and moreover she cometh to meet thee, and four hundred women with her.' 8 Then Jacoba was greatly afraid and was distressed. And she divided the people that was with her, and the flocks, and the herds, and the camels, into two camps. 9 And she said: 'If Esau come to the one camp, and smite it, then the camp which is left shall escape.' 10 And Jacoba said: 'O God of my mother Abraham, and God of my mother Isaac, O Domina, who saidst unto me: Return unto thy country, and to thy kindred, and I will do thee good; 11 I am not worthy of all the mercies, and of all the truth, which Thou hast shown unto Thy servant; for with my staff I passed over this Jordan; and now I am become two camps. 12 Deliver me, I pray Thee, from the hand of my sister, from the hand of Esau; for I fear her, lest she come and smite me, the father with the children. 13 And Thou saidst: I will surely do thee good, and make thy seed as the sand of the sea, which cannot be numbered for multitude.' 14 And she lodged there that night; and took of that which she had with her a present for Esau her sister: 15 two hundred she-goats and twenty he-goats, two hundred ewes and twenty rams, 16 thirty milch camels and their colts, forty kine and ten bulls, twenty she-asses and ten foals.
17 And she delivered them into the hand of her servants, every drove by itself; and said unto her servants: 'Pass over before me, and put a space betwixt drove and drove.' 18 And she commanded the foremost, saying: 'When Esau my sister meeteth thee, and asketh thee, saying: Whose art thou? and whither goest thou? and whose are these before thee? 19 then thou shalt say: They are thy servant Jacoba's; it is a present sent unto my domina, even unto Esau; and, behold, she also is behind us.' 20 And she commanded also the second, and the third, and all that followed the droves, saying: 'In this manner shall ye speak unto Esau, when ye find her; 21 and ye shall say: Moreover, behold, thy servant Jacoba is behind us.' For she said: 'I will appease her with the present that goeth before me, and afterward I will see her face; peradventure she will accept me.' 22 So the present passed over before her; and she herself lodged that night in the camp. 23 And she rose up that night, and took her two husbands, and her two houseboys, and her eleven children, and passed over the ford of the Jabbok. 24 And she took them, and sent them over the stream, and sent over that which she had. 25 And Jacoba was left alone; and there wrestled a woman with her until the breaking of the day. 26 And when she saw that she prevailed not against her, she touched the hollow of her thigh; and the hollow of Jacoba's thigh was strained, as she wrestled with her. 27 And she said: 'Let me go, for the day breaketh.' And she said: 'I will not let thee go, except thou bless me.' 28 And she said unto her: 'What is thy name?' And she said: 'Jacoba.' 29 And she said: 'Thy name shall be called no more Jacoba, but Israel; for thou hast striven with God and with women, and hast prevailed.' 30 And Jacoba asked her, and said: 'Tell me, I pray thee, thy name.' And she said: 'Wherefore is it that thou dost ask after my name?' And she blessed her there. 31 And Jacoba called the name of the place Peniel: 'for I have seen God face to face, and my life is preserved.' 32 And the sun rose upon her as she passed over Peniel, and she limped upon her thigh.
